qas.question: How many of Detroit's residential lots are are underdeveloped?
How many of Detroit's housing is unoccupied?
How many home in Detroit need minor repairs?
How many of Detroit's home are in good condition?
Where are most of the low density area of Detroit located?

answers.text: northeast and on the city's fringes

context: The city has numerous neighborhoods consisting of vacant properties resulting in low inhabited density in those areas, stretching city services and infrastructure. These neighborhoods are concentrated in the <a4_0>northeast and on the city's fringes<a4_0/>. A 2009 parcel survey found about <a0_0>a quarter<a0_0/> of residential lots in the city to be undeveloped or vacant, and about <a1_0>10%<a1_0/> of the city's housing to be unoccupied. The survey also reported that most (<a3_0>86%<a3_0/>) of the city's homes are in good condition with a minority (<a2_0>9%<a2_0/>) in fair condition needing only minor repairs.
